What is the classification of the chemical reaction in the following equation where aluminum and oxygen combine to form aluminum oxide?
| Reactants   | Products    |
|-------------|-------------|
| Aluminum    | Aluminum Oxide |
| Oxygen      |              |

The chemical reaction you are describing is a synthesis reaction, also known as a combination reaction. In this type of reaction, two or more reactants combine to form a single product. 

For the given reaction:

- **Reactants:** Aluminum (Al) and Oxygen (O₂)
- **Product:** Aluminum Oxide (Al₂O₃)

The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

\[ 4 \text{Al} + 3 \text{O}_2 \rightarrow 2 \text{Al}_2\text{O}_3 \]

In this synthesis reaction, aluminum and oxygen are combining to form aluminum oxide.
